content:
The North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers with the aim of serving Telugu communities across North America. NATS conducts various cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities and works to preserve, propagate, and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage in North America. The organization has a 24x7 helpline (1-888-483-5848) to provide immediate assistance to anyone in need. NATS holds a bi-annual 3-day convention attended by approximately 8000 people to celebrate Telugu culture, which includes cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development for the younger generation.

Sambaralu is a cultural event held as part of NATS' bi-annual convention. It is a celebration of Telugu culture, including music, dance, food, and traditions. The event is a gathering of Telugu people living in North America and is a way to preserve, propagate, and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage. Sambaralu is an important part of NATS' mission to serve the Telugu community and provide a platform for Telugu people to come together and celebrate their culture.
